intro: Zygia schultzeana, commonly known as the Schultze's zygia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and simple, alternate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Zygia schultzeana is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
